meanings.definition: A device that detects light and converts it into an electrical signal.
meanings.sent1: The photodetector in the camera captures light to create pictures.
meanings.sent2: The security system uses a photodetector to sense any movement in the room.
meanings.sent3: The photodetector at the museum triggered an alarm when a visitor tried to touch the artwork.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like photodetectors, instantly picking up on any changes in the room.
meanings.sent5: The photodetector hummed softly as it worked, transforming light into data.

meanings.definition: A sensor that measures light intensity.
meanings.sent1: The photodetector on the streetlight adjusts the brightness based on the surrounding light levels.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use a photodetector to measure the amount of sunlight reaching the Earth's surface.
meanings.sent3: The photodetector in the garden sprinkler system ensures the plants get just the right amount of sunlight.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a photodetector, brightening up the room with its intensity.
meanings.sent5: The photodetector beeped softly as it registered the changing light levels outside.
